content: Demetrios Sampson - Department of Digital Systems Skip to content Demetrios Sampson Phone +30 210-4142766 Email sampson@unipi.gr Title Professor Office Hours Winter Semester: Mon 12:00-13:00 & Thur 15:15-16:15 Spring Semester: Mon 14:15-15:15 & Thur 14:15-15:15 Office 202 (150, Androutsou Str, Piraeus, 18532) wp_statistics_words_count 14958 Courses Knowledge and Competence Management — 8th semester e-Learning Systems — 7th semester Educational Digital Systems — 7th semester Educational Technology — 6th semester Demetrios Sampson is a Professor of Digital Systems for Learning and Education at the Department of Digital Systems, School of Information and Communication Technologies, University of Piraeus, Greece (since 2003), Director of the Master of Science (MSc) Program on Digital Learning, and Director of Research Laboratory Digital Systems in Learning and Education. Previously, he was a Professor of Learning Technologies & Director of Research at the School of Education, Humanities Faculty, Curtin University, Australia (2015-2017) and a Senior Researcher at the Information Technologies Institute of the Centre of Research and Technology – Hellas, Greece (2000-2003). He has been a Visiting Professor at 8 Universities on 4 continents: Athabasca University, Canada (2010), National Sun Yat-sen University, Taiwan (2011), University of Tunis, Tunisia (2012, 2013), Peking University, Beijing, R.P. China (2013), Beijing Normal University, R.P. China (2013), University of North Texas USA (2013), The University of Hong Kong, R.P. China (2016) and University of Tartu, Estonia (2017). His research in Learning Technologies and Digital Education has recognized significant global impact, as he is included in the list of the World’s Top 2% of Scientists in their fields according to the latest Stanford ranking based on Scopus data. He is the co-author of 314 books (2), journal articles (74), book chapters (57), and conference papers (181). He is the editor of 22 books published by Springer (accessed more than 600.000 times), the guest editor of 30 special issues in academic journals, and the editor of 50 international conference proceedings. His research publications have received 10.160+ citations with h-index 47 as listed in Scholar Google (May 2025). He has received 10 times the Best Paper Award in International Conferences on Learning Technologies. He has been a Keynote/Invited Speaker at 120+ International/National Conferences and/or Postgraduate Programs worldwide since 2001. He has been a project director, principal investigator, and/or research consultant in 75+ Research and Innovation projects with external funding of 18 M€ since 1991.  He has supervised 200+ honors and postgraduate students to successful completion since 2003. He has co-authored: Educational Data Literacy – a monograph on educational data literacy (EDL), and Educational Data Analytics for Teachers and School Leaders – an Open Access textbook for building educational data literacy competencies, both published by Springer in November 2022. He has developed and delivered the first Massive Online Open Course (MOOC) on the use of Educational Data Analytics by School Teachers (Analytics for the Classroom Teacher), offered by the edX platform (a Harvard and MIT-led global initiative) which has attracted more than 30.000 participants from 180 countries around the world since October 2016.  He led an international University-Industry Consortium (Learn2Analyse) aiming to promote professional development in Educational Data Literacy for Online Education and Training Professionals and Higher Education students, co-funded by the European Commission (Erasmus+ Knowledge Alliance Program, 2018-2021). Professor Sampson is a pioneer in bringing the open-access movement to mainstream research dissemination by leading (as Editor-in-Chief, 2003-2018) the first open-access journal in educational technology, namely the Educational Technology & Society Journal. The journal has reached #4 in Scholar Google Top Publications in Educational Technology. He has also served or serves in various leadership roles at 30 International/National Journals (Steering Committee and/or Advisory and/or Editorial Board) and 100+ International Conferences, as well as, at the Program Committee of 700+ International/National Conferences, facilitating the shaping and the establishment of the field globally. Professor Sampson has led various initiatives under IEEE, the world’s largest technical professional organization dedicated to advancing technology for the benefit of humanity, improving awareness among researchers, and opening up avenues for mentorship in learning technology. Examples of these global initiatives include the IEEE International Conference series on Advanced Learning Technologies (leading the conference since 2002) and the IEEE Technical Committee on Learning Technologies (leading this international network of more than 2000 professionals in learning technologies worldwide).  He has served as the Chair of the IEEE Technical Committee on Learning Technologies (2008-2011 and 2015-2018), having also served previously as Vice-Chair (2003-2007 and 2011-2015). He is the recipient of the IEEE Computer Society Distinguished Service Award (July 2012) and was named a Golden Core Member of the IEEE Computer Society in recognition of his contribution to the field of Learning Technologies. This most coveted recognition has been given to 500 prominent experts worldwide since 1996 by the IEEE Computer Society, the world’s leading membership organization for professionals in all aspects of modern computing, with 60,000 members from 168 countries. He is also the recipient of the Golden Nikola Tesla Chain Award of the International Society for Engineering Pedagogy (IGIP) for “International outstanding achievements in the field of Engineering Pedagogy” (September 2018). He received a Diploma in Electrical Engineering from the Democritus University of Thrace, Greece, in 1989 and a Ph.D. in Electronic Systems Engineering from the University of Essex, UK, in 1995.
